result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sammy B. Bunker

records.addlTxt: No contact directly or indirectly with victim D.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody

3:13 PM Defendant Sammy B. Bunker appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Sammy B. Bunker.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Parties argue bond. Court modifies bond to $500 Signature bond with same conditions.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

3:52 PM  Defendant Sammy B. Bunker appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video on behalf of Taylor Klokow for Sammy B. Bunker.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendants attorney enters not guilty plea and matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 3:27 PM Defendant Sammy B. Bunker appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Sammy B. Bunker.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Doesn't qualify for Public Defender services. Matter remanded to Branch 1 for appointment of Attorney.
